title: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. User is prompted with the message 'Do you want to save the changes?' with options Yes, No, and Cancel. Yes saves the changes, No discards the changes, and Cancel does nothing and remains on the Source page. Additionally, the dialog is titled 'Error'. (including the quotes).
OB: If you edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes. The error message is not clear and does not provide sufficient instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
EB: The software should provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes when the user tries to switch back to the Layout view after editing the XML in the 'source' view. The error message should be improved to clearly indicate the necessary action.
SR: To reproduce the issue, open the XML Report Designer editor and switch to the 'source' view. Edit the XML and then try switching back to the Layout view. Observe the error message prompt and the lack of clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
